channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: I hear that in a Joe Pickett novel by C. J. Box, set in Wyoming and nearby states, you’re sure to see Joe destroy a pickup truck, Marybeth solve murders in Saddlestring, and Nate get revenge. A friend recommends them. https://t.co/rOAAKlc6Tw
Re: those new space photos Overheard: "Gosh, the refracting light makes it look like you're at Zales!" https://t.co/2NyqYpFwhe

200 kinds of bees in the city “With the goal of helping community gardens produce more fresh food, scientists from six different St. Louis institutions are collaborating to research pollination in urban orchards.” https://t.co/byEPV2teqX
@gunsnrosesgirl3 @mejpearson Walt Whitman described a similar scene. https://t.co/RimOAKGx9z
Peanuts on theory, 1975. https://t.co/nBbwK57Db5
Sad how reusable this sentence is: "Someday we'll look back on this practice and think how could we have missed something so obvious."
Childhood is Without Prejudice, street mural by William Walker, E. 56th & Stony Island, Chicago. https://t.co/itGwvwasWb
Ada Limón will be Poet Laureate of the United States. https://t.co/uTBi4sbBOq https://t.co/rnC5f8kziJ

@davewiner Yes. In 1974, in southeast Alaska, a driver who gave a lift said he was just back from Anchorage, where he saw an unfamiliar thing hanging over the road. “Wow,” he reported saying, “wow, that thing must be a stoplight.”
School teaches the wrong things a good part of the time, but wouldn't have to. Here's the whole "There should be a week-long unit in school each year" collection to date. https://t.co/tehLNM9tz6

There should be a week-long unit in school each year detailing the ways the powerful, for the sake of appearances, post their plans in various out-of-the-way places "for public viewing and comment" before they smash a fist down on that big green GO button right there on the desk. https://t.co/vP1SKWj0Q5 https://t.co/lKJ9JBiwop

As mayor, at public gatherings, @PeteButtigieg made a point of talking to anyone who indicated that they hoped to have a word. He was speaking with people he knew well once when I walked up. In a moment or two he excused himself from those folks and turned to me, a stranger. https://t.co/scxS6MJ8NP

War-oriented countries like Russia and the U. S. avoid a military draft so that citizens don’t become activists. Instead, the U. S. cynically and unfairly relies in part on folks with family traditions of military service. Via @NYTimes. https://t.co/07O9rWDACK
What french fries tell us about America. https://t.co/JHFvcBsB9w
Advice to travelers. https://t.co/0tzKiOE5kP

@lisajpetrie On a trip last August, our car's AC broke and we crossed western and northern Iowa with the windows down. From great distances we sniffed approaching CAFOs, which were plentiful. One or two employee cars parked outside each building, a dismal portrait of a once-proud rural life.

Here @nytDavidBrooks traces a psychological progression that many mass shooters may follow. Next question: What is it about our society that sets a substantial number of people, "a steady stream of young men," as he says, on this path? https://t.co/KMrIL4dq10
“A bit depressing to know that I might die before we have clean water in Iowa…” https://t.co/jPuJbvXXGu
Who gets to name your life? https://t.co/8VSR83MTeV

Western writers evaluated and gave names to the actions of Czech people trying to live freer lives, and these names given by others often simplified and obscured parts of the story. Havel suggests this in the opening lines of "The power of the powerless," the essay, not the book.

"We know that in so many of these mass shootings that are now becoming weekly events that the guns are being obtained legally. That should tell all of us that the laws aren't doing their job, if people can't go out to enjoy a 4th of July parade…” https://t.co/xXEppdxkBg

Not quite a week yet, but I asked our regional grocery chain about people carrying guns in the stores--whether or not they have a policy about that. I asked here and by email. No reply either place. https://t.co/3Njtpa8vNt
It's not a painting in the usual sense. It's a set of instructions for a painting. That's how the painter does his work. https://t.co/Z2F9f4EJH0

Building on Drummer features, Andy Sylvester has written an app that demonstrates a topic-focused collaboration & multi-author resource publication built around an opml outline that is able to _include_ other people's opml outlines. https://t.co/iV9zaWzmsz
"People are going to have sex." https://t.co/fLhtWw0fMm
